data.title: Energy Star portfolio manager
data.description: Portfolio Manager is an interactive resource management tool that enables you to benchmark the energy use of any type of building, all in a secure online environment.

data.title: eensight
data.description: The goal of the eensight tool is to contribute to the advancement of the automated measurement and verification (M&V) methods for energy efficiency. The eensight Python package accompanies the deliverable `D7.1 Methods for the dynamic measurement and verification of energy savings` of the H2020 project [SENSEI](https://senseih2020.eu/) Smart Energy Services to Improve the Energy Efficiency of the European Building Stock.

data.title: eemeter
data.description: EEmeter — an open source toolkit for implementing and developing standard methods for calculating normalized metered energy consumption (NMEC) and avoided energy use. Developed by [Recurve](https://www.recurve.com/open-source), on [Github](https://github.com/openeemeter/eemeter)

data.title: Climate View
data.description: ClimateView, a Swedish software development company working on monitoring and visualization tools for greenhouse gas emissions, create innovative technology to help cities understand and execute the shifts necessary to address the climate emergency. Raised $2.5 million in Oct 2021, from [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2020/04/08/climateview-raises-2-5-million-for-its-toolkit-to-visualize-climate-mitigation-plans/), investors include the [Norrsken Foundation](https://www.norrsken.org/), an impact investment firm established by Klarna co-founder Niklas Adalberth

data.title: Advanced Infrastructure
data.description: Advanced Infrastructure's mission is to create a greener and fairer Energy System by making big data, transparency, and traceability accessible to all users of the energy system.

data.title: R8 Technologies - Digital Operator
data.description: Based in Estonia, R8 Digital Operator is solving mathematically the problem of regulating the BMS and HVAC controllable parameters by including building dynamical modelling, real-time user interaction and predictions of weather and electricity prices to heat, ventilate and cool at the right time and the right amount.

data.title: Qenergy
data.description: Q Energy solution maximises the value of converting a building into a smart building solution, reducing energy costs by as much as 30 to 50 percent. Q Energy is currently positioned to focus on Behind-the-meter (BTM) solutions for commercial & industrial customers.

data.title: Brainbox AI
data.description: Located in Montreal, Canada our team is comprised of experts in the fields of AI, data science, real estate, HVAC and energy efficiency. We are driven by the fact that 20% of global greenhouse gas emissions originate from buildings and that HVAC systems are responsible for over 50% of those emissions.

data.title: Autodesk green building studio
data.description: Green Building Studio is a flexible cloud-based service that allows you to run building performance simulations to optimize energy efficiency and to work toward carbon neutrality earlier in the design process.

data.title: Twinview
data.description: Twinview is a browser-based Digital Twin platform for the property sector connecting building systems’ data to a 3D model viewed on a single dashboard. Twinview is a part of [Space Group](https://spacegroup.co.uk/) - who specialise in the development of digital applications and services to improve the outcomes of the built environment. In [June 21](https://www.twinfm.com/article/great-portland-estates-integrates-digital-twin-technology-into-office-refurbishment) deployed to the Hickman building, whitechapel

data.title: Aurora Solar
data.description: One platform for any solar project. Create a complete engineering design and sales proposal with just an address and an electric bill. Raised 250M in a round C in May 2021, from [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2021/05/24/aurora-solar-aims-to-power-the-growing-solar-industry-with-a-250m-round-c/) following a [Round A](https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/04/aurora-solars-computer-generated-installation-maps-pull-in-a-20m-series-a/) and B in the previous 2 years

data.title: QOS energy
data.description: monitoring and optimisation of renewable generation assets

data.title: OakTree power
data.description: Offering Flexibility services for buildings to generate revenue streams. Based in London

data.title: Aquicore
data.description: Aquicore is an analytics software to drive profitable, sustainable, and resilient buildings. Keyframe invested in them

data.title: Net2grid
data.description: mobile app for energy consumption insights and efficiency. Finalists of free electrons 2020

data.title: Enian
data.description: ENIAN is on a mission to fix our broken energy system with data and software. Their platform is an enterprise SaaS solution that provides all of the management tools for renewable energy professionals.

data.title: Cortex
data.description: Cortex is built to dramatically improve how buildings operate by applying software and analytics to highly underutilized data streams. By building the software and analytics layer overtop these disparate data streams, we can fundamentally improve the sustainability of commercial buildings, the value of those assets, and the experience of occupants inside them.

data.title: Station A
data.description: Instead of providing bits and pieces of data and functionality, we are reimagining how clean energy projects are evaluated and developed from origination to operation.

data.title: Volttron
data.description: Volttron is a flexible, scalable, economical and secure software platform to operate the Internet of Things developed at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory and available as an open-source tool. The U.S. Department of Energy views the technology as a central component of buildings-grid integration, and provides funding support. [Github repo](https://github.com/VOLTTRON/volttron)

data.title: Arbnco
data.description: building performance software platform for utilities, national property managers and commercial real estate.

data.title: Dabbel
data.description: Buildings, self-driven. The DABBEL AI reduces your building’s HVAC energy consumption and CO₂ emissions by up to 40%. Based in Dusseldorf

data.title: Bee Bryte
data.description: software-as-a-service minimizing utility bills with automatic control of heating-cooling equipment (e.g. HVAC), pumps, EV charging points and/or batteries. Based in Lyon and Singapore.

data.title: Electric Miles
data.description: Electric Miles connects EV charging with batteries to provide smart tariffs and grid flexibility. Has partnered with [Project EV](https://www.projectev.co.uk/) to implement a network of chargers, in the News [Dec 2021](https://www.energylivenews.com/2021/12/10/new-partnership-eyes-100k-ev-smart-charge-points/)

data.title: Bonnet electric
data.description: mobile app with a map for EV charging and a monthly fee structure that includes a certain amount of kwh

data.title: Dreev
data.description: EV Smart charging V2G platform. Dreev solution relies on Nuvve technology that has already been deployed and validated on 5 continents. Dreev is a creation of both San Diego based [Nuvve](https://nuvve.com/) and EDF Pulse Expansion.

data.title: EV energy
data.description: Our smart platform manages EV charging, automatically optimizing for a greener, cheaper charge.

data.title: Energy Storage Computational Tool (ESCT)
data.description: The Energy Storage Computational Tool (ESCT) is a Microsoft Excel based application that was funded by DOE Office of Electricity Delivery and Energy Reliability (OE) and developed by Navigant Consulting.

data.title: Argand solutions
data.description: Devon based Argand enable renewables and / or energy storage to connect to the Grid and these assets to then perform optimally through better data and analysis. [GridMAP](https://www.argandsolutions.com/gridmap-optimum-energy-storage-modelling) provides pre & post-project modelling and optimisation analysis for solar PV, wind, CHP and energy storage systems.

data.title: StorageVET and DER-VET
data.description: The Electric Power Research Institute [EPRI](https://www.epri.com/about) conducts research, development, and demonstration projects for the benefit of the public in the United States and internationally. StorageVET 2.1 facilitates the understanding of where to place and install energy storage, the optimum size as well as controls options. [DER-VET™](https://www.der-vet.com/) is a publicly available, open-source, optimization-based energy valuation and planning tool for distributed energy resources (DER) and larger, centralized energy resources

data.title: Device Pilot
data.description: Service monitoring for connected devices: the process of collecting streams of data from individual devices, turning them into metrics, and from those deriving Key Performance Indicators for your device estate as a whole

data.title: Breathe
data.description: Breathe’s Lincc software is the first to bring advanced battery management techniques to electric vehicles and consumer electronics. A spin-out of Imperial that raised £1.5 million seed round led by Speedinvest in Oct 2021

data.title: Twaice
data.description: Our predictive analytics increase the lifetime, efficiency ​and sustainability of batteries. raised 26M in May 2021, [in the news](https://techcrunch.com/2021/05/19/twaice-raised-26m-to-scale-its-battery-analytics-software/)​

data.title: Enegen
data.description: Enegen Power Systems (formally Dunstan Thomas Energy division) is a leading U.K. based provider of scheduling, wholesale and Balancing Mechanism dispatch and commercial optimisation software

data.title: Levelise
data.description: Oxford based Levelise developed a home energy management system that links domestic battery systems to a suite of algorithmic controls

data.title: Arenko
data.description: Optimisation of technical and commercial performance of flexible assets in real time. Arenko underwent a significant transformation in July 2020, selling its only battery storage asset and transitioning into the software sector entirely. from [Current News](https://www.current-news.co.uk/blogs/a-pure-play-software-company-arenkos-rupert-newland-on-flexibility-and-the-new-battery-markets)

data.title: Tesla's Opticaster
data.description: Opticaster is Tesla’s intelligent software designed to maximize economic benefits and sustainability objectives for distributed energy resources.

data.title: Tesla's Autobidder
data.description: Autobidder is a real-time trading and control platform that provides value-based asset management and portfolio optimization, enabling owners and operators to configure operational strategies that maximize revenue according to their business objectives and risk preferences.

data.title: Modularity Grid
data.description: Part of a consortium developing minigrids for low income communities in rural off-grid areas across Uganda. Working with Airbus to build a proof of concept with technologies applied to aerospace. In the news on [Wired](https://www.wired.co.uk/article/mini-power-grids)

data.title: Ohm Connect
data.description: OhmHours are energy saving events, usually an hour in length, in which OhmConnect has committed to the grid that our users (you!) will save energy. From [CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/07/alphabet-backed-sidewalk-bets-on-getting-customers-to-cut-energy-use-.html): received $100 million from Alphabet-backed [Sidewalk Infrastructure Partners](https://sidewalkinfra.com/) to build the largest distributed clean power plant in North America. SIP invested $20 million in OhmConnect directly, with the additional $80 million going towards building a virtual power plant. Another 55M in [June 2022](https://www.finsmes.com/2022/06/ohmconnect-raises-55m-in-series-d-funding.html)

data.title: Kaluza
data.description: Kaluza is OVO Group’s technology platform ecosystem that is driving the transition to a zero carbon grid. Its software platforms enable energy suppliers to empower their customers with unique digital experiences and smart, low carbon technologies

data.title: Greencom Networks
data.description: Greencom Networks based in Munich and Sophia Antipolis develops an Energy Information Brokerage Platform made of Connect (a data gateway) + a web platform + a set of applications.

data.title: Verv energy
data.description: Verv energy is a trading name of [Green running](https://www.greenrunning.com/about-us/) in 2017 raised 500k on Crowdcube, providing electricity data [disaggregation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZnJeA4-42W4) on signals with resolution of 1s. Verv has also a blockchain solution (see dedicated section).

data.title: EnergyOS
data.description: EnergyOS is the platform built on top of research done by CSIRO (Australia) for their [grid modelling tools](https://www.csiro.au/en/Research/EF/Areas/Electricity-grids-and-systems/Intelligent-systems)

data.title: Flexible power / powermatcher
data.description: Flexible power / powermatcher is the open source platform released by EF-PI (see above standard section, not really a standard though)

data.title: Advmicrogrid
data.description: Advmicrogrid Analytics platform for demand side response and asset management with machine learning, advanced microgrid solutions (closed source), big US based

data.title: Genability
data.description: Genability Big US based products and platform for assets, micro-grids, etc. management with machine learning

data.title: auto-grid
data.description: auto-grid Massive US based company (recently had 20M+ in funding) building platform for assets management, optimisation, machine learning etc. [link youtube](https://youtu.be/MIijeMOPlBY)

data.title: AMPP
data.description: AMPP - Analytics and insights for off-grid assets

data.title: Eloncity
data.description: (defunct) Eloncity - Mega platform (under development) Singapore based with blockchain and devices

data.title: Eliq
data.description: Eliq provides software to monitor electricity usage and demand patterns. It takes information from smart metering, connected devices and weather analytics and interprets this to provide instant energy insights and promote efficiency. Awarded phase 2 of UK gov [SENS competition](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smart-energy-savings-sens-competition)

data.title: EnPowered
data.description: Canada based EnPowered has a platform that measures Rates, capacity or demand charges, delivery fees - market spikes drive up costs in energy bills, making forecasts to plan usage and avoid costly events.

data.title: Smap Energy
data.description: SMAP Energy originated from research at the University of Cambridge. In collaboration with our academic and industrial partners, we’ve developed novel machine learning and AI techniques and products that take advantage of growing smart meter data reserves. [Acquired by Japanese firm ENECHANGE](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/smart-meter-data-firm-smap-energy-snapped-up-by-enechange) in March 2021

data.title: Utility API
data.description: Utility API , Web api platform for energy consumption and bills

data.title: Awesense
data.description: Access externally-built analytics, applications, queries, and notebooks. Sell and share your solutions on the Awesense marketplace and expand revenue streams. Based mainly in Vancouver

data.title: Reactive technologies
data.description: Not really sure what they do?  Reactive technologies grid analytics and cloud solutions maybe? Been [funded by Ingenious](http://www.theingeniousgroup.co.uk/news-views/ingenious-backs-smart-energy-future-with-investment-into-reactive-technologies/)

data.title: Qbots
data.description: Qbots AI + API don’t think they have anything released open source

data.title: GridMarket
data.description: GridMarket app for microgrid monitoring mentioned [in the news](https://microgridknowledge.com/worlds-largest-microgrid-engie-eps/) for their installation in Palau (Micronesia)

data.title: Gengame
data.description: Gengame mobile-gaming industry tools and techniques to solve utilities' challenges, have recently (start 2019) been awarded [a grant from BEIS](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/783338/BEIS_innovative_domestic_demand-side_response-competition_phase_2.pdf)

data.title: Mosaik
data.description: Mosaik allows you to reuse and combine existing simulation models and simulators to create large-scale Smart Grid scenarios

data.title: Enervee
data.description: Enervee home appliances marketplace with energy consumption score

data.title: Power paired
data.description: Power paired is a platform for asset management for Community Energy Groups

data.title: CO2 Analytics
data.description: CO2 Analytics integrates with Xero to provide carbon footprint Measurement & Management Platform for Small and Midsize Businesses

data.title: NILMTK
data.description: NILMTK Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring (NILM) is the process of estimating the energy consumed by individual appliances given just a whole-house power meter reading. Initially developed by Jack Kelly, co-founder of Openclimatefix

data.title: Tibber
data.description: Tibber discovered that electricity customers found the offerings from traditional electricity utilities boring, expensive and very complex. The platform automates the process of buying electricity from distributors when it's cheaper and organises consumption for efficiency (assumptions based on descriptions found on website)

data.title: Enyday
data.description: Enyday , based in Copenhagen (website in Danish only) wants to become a catalyst for the mass deployment of small renewable energy plants such as solar cells and wind turbines. Basically a platform to share sustainable production in community schemas.

data.title: Greenely
data.description: Greenely , Swedish only website, app to manage energy consumption

data.title: OnSSET
data.description: OnSSET open source software platform for the assessment and deployment of conventional and renewable energy technologies based on spatial data describing population density and distribution, proximity to transmission and road network, nighttime lights. Aiming at ensuring access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all.

data.title: NETfficient
data.description: NETfficient ran from January 2015 to December 2018. It has deployed and demonstrated local energy storage technologies and developed smart technologies to exploit the synergies between energy storage, the smart grid and the citizens. Entails both hybrid hardware and software solutions

data.title: OpenMUC
data.description: OpenMUC is a software framework based on Java and OSGi that simplifies the development of customized monitoring, logging and control systems.

data.title: Patch
data.description: Patch mission is to reach giga-tonne scale carbon sequestration. Businesses need to focus on both rapidly decarbonizing their operations and compensating unavoidable emissions.

data.title: Carbon footprint calculator
data.description: Carbon footprint calculator Built by Protea, a social network community to reduce your effect on the climate.

data.title: Tomorrow app
data.description: Tomorrow app automatically calculates your carbon footprint by connecting to other services and apps in your life, here's the [open source models](https://github.com/tmrowco/tmrowapp-contrib), same group that developed the [Electricity Map](https://www.electricitymap.org/)

data.title: A spreadsheet
data.description: A spreadsheet with a list of carbon calculators maintained by Chris from [Cambridgeshire Climate emergency](http://camemergency.org/)

data.title: A post on Disco CAT
data.description: A post on Disco CAT with a list of carbon footprint calculators and tracking tools

data.title: eSmart Systems
data.description: eSmart Systems - backed by energy impact partners - builds and delivers the next generation software solutions for inspections of powerlines, grid maintenance planning and energy flexibility optimization.

data.title: Zeigo
data.description: Zeigo is a technology platform supporting both supply and demand of renewable energy. Winner of BusinessGreen for [Renewable Energy Technology](https://www.businessgreen.com/bg/news/3084522/businessgreen-technology-awards-all-the-winners) of the year 2019. Zeigo has built an extensive network of renewable energy generators and suppliers. Find solutions for Corporate PPAs, Utility PPAs and Certificates. Partnered with co-op power [in Dec 21](https://theenergyst.com/co-op-aiming-to-tackle-scope-3-emissions-with-aggregated-ppa/)

data.title: Watershed
data.description: Watershed helps businesses cut carbon emissions, from the a bunch of guys who were in Stripe

data.title: Microsoft Sustainability Calculator
data.description: Microsoft Sustainability Calculator a Power BI application for Azure enterprise customers that provides new insight into carbon emissions data associated with their Azure services

data.title: Green Sync
data.description: Green Sync is Australia’s home grown demand-side management provider. Offering a range of products, above all worth mentioning the energy marketplace [deX](https://dex.energy/)

data.title: Smarter Grid solutions
data.description: Smarter Grid solutions working with Distribution Utilities, System Operators and Energy Asset Operators to seamlessly and effortlessly integrate DER assets to the grid, and energy and flexibility markets.

data.title: Leap
data.description: Leap Off-peak energy trading platform, funded by national grid

data.title: WPD Intraflex
data.description: Western Power Distribution's IntraFlex lowers entry barriers to owners of assets such as EV chargers, permitting them to dip into Britain's expanding market for flex trading.

data.title: Nodes
data.description: NODES is the independent marketplace for a sustainable energy future where grid owners, producers and consumers of energy can trade decentralised flexibility and energy. Similar to Piclo

data.title: Piclo
data.description: Piclo, Grid flexibility marketplace Platform, similar to [Nodes](https://nodesmarket.com/).

data.title: Tem energy
data.description: founder is from the Limejump team, renewable energy marketplace. Essentially an energy trader without regulation

data.title: Upside energy
data.description: Upside energy Cloud software for demand side response with AI. Has become Kraken Flex

data.title: GridX
data.description: We connect distributed energy resources on a single platform. We optimize energy flows to make the most efficient use of energy. Based in Munich

data.title: Faraday grid
data.description: Faraday grid, Edinburgh based, [backed by WeWork co-founder](https://theenergyst.com/faraday-grid-lands-25m-investment/) and Amp Energy [went bust in 2019](). Intended to provide hardware + software for DER

data.title: Opus one
data.description: Opus one Toronto based, DER and DSR platform

data.title: Enbala
data.description: Enbala Vancouver + Denver based platform for virtual power plant and DSR optimisation

data.title: Sympower
data.description: We help you unlock the value of your flexibility. We do this with electric assets across industries. In March 21 they've raised 5.2M in series B, from [Tech.eu](https://tech.eu/brief/amsterdam-based-sympower-powers-up-with-e5-2-million-investment-in-series-b-round/)

data.title: Voltus
data.description: Voltus Demand side response and energy efficiency platform

data.title: Camus energy
data.description: Camus energy sylicon valley startup developing a platform (allegedly open source) for ancillary services and real-time trading

data.title: Emitwise
data.description: Emitwise wants to enable companies to become carbon neutral by helping businesses track the carbon footprint of their organisation, including scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions.

data.title: Synapsys
data.description: Synapsys Founded in 2001 by experienced engineers, Synapsys Solutions develops and supplies innovative interfacing, integration and communication solutions for the intelligent building control industry.

data.title: EP&T
data.description: EP&T deliver outcomes through operational efficiency in the built environment. We combine the Internet of Things, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Human Expertise to deliver cost reductions and improved comfort conditions.

data.title: Simptek
data.description: Simptek Canadian company, provides insights into any building’s energy usage, identifying opportunities for cost savings

data.title: Sefaira
data.description: Sefaira - early stage analysis for designers who care about building performance. Similar to IES, integrated in [Sketchup](https://www.sketchup.com/products/sefaira)

data.title: Demand Logic
data.description: Demand Logic is an energy control and optimisation platform for commercial buildings, similar to Fabriq.

data.title: Fabriq
data.description: Fabriq Building / Assets Energy monitoring platform

data.title: EnergyPlus
data.description: EnergyPlus is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption—for heating, cooling, ventilation, lighting and plug and process loads—and water use in buildings. Funded by the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE) Building Technologies Office (BTO), and managed by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)

data.title: Systems Link
data.description: Systems Link is owned by Inspired Energy (see below in the companies section) and is a full energy monitoring platform with support for tenants

data.title: Quby formerly Toon
data.description: Quby with their [Toon](https://www.toon.eu/) devices is Dutch platform offering smart thermostats for residential, acquired by [Eneco](https://www.enecogroup.com/) a big energy company providing infrastructure with renewable and batteries. (Toon uses databricks / airflow / spark / aws for computation, [here](https://databricks.com/session/using-apache-spark-in-the-cloud-a-devops-perspective))

data.title: Nuuka
data.description: Nuuka is a Finnish software company that develops and provides Smart Building Management Software to commercial real estate owners.

data.title: Grid edge
data.description: UK based Grid Edge transforms existing building into digital twin and data-driven insights help reduce energy demand with efficiency savings and improved operations and control. They want to change the way that people use energy by putting data-driven, intelligent control into the hands of commercial energy consumers. Has [raised 2.5M in Oct 19](https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/news-and-insights/press-releases/bp-expands-its-digital-energy-portfolio-by-investing-in-energy-management-platform-grid-edge.html) from BP Ventures

data.title: IES - Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)
data.description: Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)  is a digital twin & simulation software to assess energy consumption and optimisation for aggregation of buildings in communities, developed by Integrated Environmental Solutions (IES)

data.title: EC3
data.description: EC3 is a free, industry-supported, construction-specific material search and planning tool that helps construction professionals quantify EC, find high-impact reductions, and guide procurement to reduce embodied carbon.

data.title: ZERO Code Energy Calculator
data.description: ZERO Code Energy Calculator relying on others' standards

data.title: RETScreen
data.description: Implemented by the Canadian government, RETScreen® Clean Energy Management Software platform enables low-carbon planning, implementation, monitoring and reporting.

data.title: The System Advisor Model (SAM)
data.description: The System Advisor Model (SAM)  is a free techno-economic software model that facilitates decision-making for people in the renewable energy industry. Also has a web version with smaller feature set called [REopt](https://reopt.nrel.gov/faq.html). Check their [GH account](https://github.com/NREL) for what released open source

data.title: Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe - ROSE
data.description: Nata nel 2014, nell’ambito dell’Associazione Genova Smart City, ROSE (Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe) è utilizzata nella Smart Polygeneration Microgrid del Campus di Savona dell’Università di Genova, scelto da Enel come Living Lab.

data.title: Solar pro tool
data.description: Austrian software for solar panel design with 3D

data.title: Sighten
data.description: Sighten Platform for solar workflow management, from planning, financing, installation, monitoring, support

data.title: PVGIS
data.description: PVGIS has been developed for more than 10 years at the European Commission Joint Research Centre, at the JRC site in Ispra, Italy. The focus of PVGIS is research in solar resource assessment, photovoltaic (PV) performance studies, and the dissemination of knowledge and data about solar radiation and PV performance.

data.title: Solcast
data.description: Solcast are dedicated to developing the data and tools needed to plan, construct, operate and manage solar power systems across the world.

data.title: ABSolar
data.description: Absolar is a University of Southampton spin out. Has implemented a software platform that makes an assessment of solar radiation and PV potential for the built environment

data.title: Solargis
data.description: Solargis provide reliable and accurate solar, weather and solar electricity data that are used in the whole lifecycle of solar power plants, from prospection to development and operation

data.title: Power Transition
data.description: Hedera based platform that provides tracking and accounting of energy production, transmission and storage and consumption by and between all elements of a grid and microgrid network.

data.title: Sitigrid
data.description: The Sitigrid distributed ledger technology, S-Chain, creates an immutable record of all energy that is generated and consumed within the network, enabling peer-to-peer trading of surplus electricity on the open market, through smart contracts and settlements.

data.title: Energy Web
data.description: Energy Web (EW) is a global nonprofit organization accelerating a low-carbon, customer-centric electricity system.  EW focuses on building core infrastructure and shared technology. After launching their enterprise blockchain platform tailored to the energy sector in 2019, EW’s technology roadmap has since grown into the Energy Web Decentralized Operating System (EW-DOS), a full stack that includes front-end applications and a variety of software development toolkits.

data.title: Positive Energy
data.description: Singapore based, European founders. Positive Energy's mission is to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy assets globally with a platform that digitizes the asset finance workflow creating greater efficiency in business processes, operations, transparency and security resulting in higher profitability and performance.

data.title: EnergiMine
data.description: EnergiMine blockchain that focuses on making energy procurement smarter, improving efficiency, cost effectiveness and ultimately, mitigating the effects of climate change. In the news [11.6.19](https://theenergyst.com/energi-mine-plans-global-peer-to-peer-energy-exchange/)

data.title: Energy Web
data.description: Energy Web open-source, scalable blockchain platform specifically designed for the energy sector’s regulatory, operational, and market needs. Apparently [used by Siemens](https://cointelegraph.com/news/siemens-joins-blockchain-driven-energy-platform-to-increase-interoperability-in-industry)

data.title: Vlux
data.description: Vlux is the blockchain that powers Verv (see section above)

data.title: Power ledger
data.description: Power ledger just won (oct 18) the extreme tech challenge XTC

data.title: Data61 - CSIRO
data.description: CSIRO Data61 are doing research on the distributed ledger for energy space but their updates seem stuck since 2018

data.title: Echoin from Powerlinks
data.description: Echoin from Powerlinks Beijing based, contracts with EDF, presented at Mission Innovation workshop

data.title: Electron
data.description: Electron London based, presented at Mission Innovation workshop

data.title: Prosume - formerly Dajie
data.description: Blockchain powered Carbon credits produced by solar and consumed in micro-grid,  Dajie
